When the Earth Alliance invades Orb to acquire their mass driver, Uzumi reveals to Cagalli that Kira Yamato is her brother and forces her to leave Orb before he self detonates it to prevent the Earth Alliance from using their equipment for war.

character.name: GAT-X131 Calamity Gundam
character.description: The Calamity Gundam is one of three new Earth Alliance prototypes deployed in the invasion of the Orb Union. Based on an X100-series frame similar to that of the Buster Gundam, this new machine is likewise designed for long-range artillery attacks. However, with its improved Trans-Phase Armor and overwhelming firepower, the Calamity is far superior to its predecessor. In order to draw out its full potential this powerful mobile suit is assigned to Orga Sabnak, one of the artificially enhanced pilots the Alliance refers to as biological CPUs.

character.name: GAT-X252 Forbidden Gundam
character.description: The Forbidden Gundam is one of three new Earth Alliance prototypes deployed in the invasion of the Orb Union. Based on an X200-series frame like that of the Blitz Gundam, this machine features several unique weapons systems. Its Trans-Phase Armor and energy-deflecting Geschmeidig Panzer shields protect the Forbidden from both physical attacks and beam weapons, and by generating a magnetic field between its railguns, the Forbidden can bend the beams of its plasma cannon to make them harder to evade. It also carries a heavy scythe capable of slicing an enemy warship in half. In the hands of the biological CPU Shani Andras, this machine is as unpredictable as it is dangerous.

character.name: GAT-X370 Raider Gundam
character.description: The Raider Gundam is one of three new Earth Alliance prototypes deployed in the invasion of the Orb Union. Based on an X300-series frame similar to that of the Aegis Gundam, this machine transforms into a birdlike mobile armour for high-speed flight, and in this form it can also carry another mobile suit on its back. Because the Raider is designed for close combat, its armament consists mainly of short-range beam cannons and machine guns, as well as a mace-like spherical breaker. This mobile suit is assigned to the biological CPU Clotho Buer.

character.name: FX-550 Skygrasper
character.description: A specialized fighter aircraft created to support the Strike Gundam. The Skygrasper is designed to carry Striker packs out into the battlefield so that the Strike can replace its equipment in mid-battle, and the fighter itself can also use the Striker packs` weapons in combat. The Skygrasper`s built-in weaponry includes a powerful beam cannon and a pair of heavy machine guns, as well as weapons bays for storing bombs and missiles. Two Skygraspers are transferred to the Archangel when it joins with the Earth Alliance`s 8th Fleet, and after the ship descends to Earth, Mu La Flaga begins using one of these atmospheric fighters in place of his Moebius Zero mobile armour.

character.name: GAT-01 Strike Dagger
character.description: The Earth Alliance`s first mass-produced mobile suit, which was based on data from the prototype Strike Gundam. The Strike Dagger`s operating system is designed for use by Naturals, making it possible for ordinary Alliance soldiers to pilot these complex machines. Its design has been greatly simplified due to the requirements of wartime production, and it thus lacks the Phase Shift Armor, Striker pack technology, and overall high performance of the original Strike. Nonetheless, these incomplete machines soon prove their worth in mass battle against ZAFT`s own mobile suit forces.

character.name: TS-MA2mod.00 Moebius Zero
character.description: An Earth Alliance special forces mobile armour, which served as a prototype for the mass-produced version of the Moebius. In addition to the standard linear gun, the Moebius Zero is equipped with a set of wire-guided gunbarrels, which can overwhelm enemy mobile suits with a simultaneous multi-directional attack. Mu La Flaga, one of the few pilots capable of operating these gunbarrels, earned the nickname "Hawk of Endymion" by using his Moebius Zero to destroy five GINNs in a battle on the lunar surface.

character.name: TS-MA2 Moebius
character.description: This mass-produced mobile armour is the backbone of the Earth Alliance space forces. In addition to a pair of built-in vulcan cannons, the Moebius can be equipped with a variety of missiles and heavy weapons, and its standard armament is a powerful linear gun capable of destroying an enemy mobile suit or blasting through a warship`s hull armour. However, the overall performance of the Moebius is hopelessly inferior to that of the mobile suits used by ZAFT.

character.name: MAW-01 Mistral
character.description: An Earth Alliance combat pod which is often employed as a worker machine in space colonies and aboard warships. The Mistral can be used for gathering resources, recovering damaged spacecraft, and other such tasks. Its upper section is equipped with four telescoping arms, and can detach from its base and manoeuvre independently.

character.name: Agamemnon-kyuu Uchuu Bokan
character.description: This 300-meter warship is designed primarily as a carrier, and it can rapidly deploy large numbers of mobile armors using its two linear catapults. Warships of the Agamemnon class, like Admiral Halberton`s Menelaos, often serve as flagships for the Earth Alliance`s space fleets.

character.name: 250m-class
character.description: This 250-meter warship, heavily armed and equipped with an internal storage bay for its complement of mobile armors, is the backbone of the Earth Alliance`s space fleets. The Montgomery - the flagship of the advance force which comes to meet the Archangel - is a warship of this type, as are the 8th Fleet`s Cassandros, Ptolemaios, and Paris.

character.name: 130m-class escort
character.description: This 130-meter escort ship is armed only with 75mm vulcan cannons, missile launchers, and torpedo tubes, and has no internal storage for mobile armors. The Bernard and the Law - members of the advance force which comes to meet the Archangel - are escort ships of this type, as are the 8th Fleet`s Seleukos, Antigonos, Xerxes, and Belgrano.

character.name: Powell
character.description: The Earth Alliance`s assault landing ship which serves as Muruta Azrael`s base of operations during the invasion of the Orb Union. These ships have been converted to carry mobile suits, which exit via the gates on their sides, and are equipped with anti-air beam cannons to defend them against ZAFT mobile suits. They also double as aircraft carriers for the Alliance`s fighter planes.

character.name: ZGMF-X13A Providence Gundam
character.description: ZAFT`s newest and most powerful prototype mobile suit. Like the Freedom and Justice, the Providence Gundam is equipped with a Neutron Jammer Canceler and powered by a nuclear engine, and it`s armed with a set of remote weapons inspired by the gunbarrels of the Moebius Zero. This DRAGOON System can be used to attack enemies from multiple directions at the same time, but its high energy consumption means it can only be used by a nuclear-powered machine like the Providence, and it requires a pilot with superhuman powers of spatial awareness. As a result, this unique mobile suit becomes the personal machine of Rau Le Creuset, who uses it to devastating effect during the Second Battle of Jachin Due.

character.name: ZGMF-X09A Justice Gundam
character.description: Like the Freedom Gundam, this prototype mobile suit was developed using captured Earth Alliance technology, and it has an effectively unlimited energy supply thanks to its Neutron Jammer Canceler and nuclear engine. The Justice Gundam carries the same beam rifle, beam sabers, and anti-beam shield as the Freedom, and its shoulders house a pair of beam boomerangs inspired by the Sword Strike Gundam`s Midas Messer. The Fatum-00 flight support unit attached to its back is armed with a pair of powerful beam cannons, and can detach to serve as a remote-controlled flying platform. The Justice is assigned to ZAFT pilot Athrun Zala in order to pursue and destroy the stolen Freedom.

character.name: METEOR
character.description: The Mobile suit Embedded Tactical EnfORcer, or METEOR, is an armed module designed to support the Freedom Gundam and Justice Gundam. These METEOR units serve as gun turrets while attached to the hull of the warship Eternal, and when detached they can dock with a Gundam and draw energy from its nuclear engine. The METEOR is equipped with powerful thrusters for high-speed flight, and its beam cannons, missile launchers, and beam swords give it the firepower of a space warship. Since the Freedom and Justice have the ability to lock onto multiple targets, they can use the METEOR`s battery of long-range weapons to intercept dozens of enemies simultaneously.

character.name: GAT-X102 Duel Gundam
character.description: The Duel Gundam is one of four prototype Earth Alliance mobile suits captured by ZAFT. The Duel is the earliest and the most orthodox of the GAT-X units, and this general-purpose machine served as a development base for the more specialized Buster and Strike. The Duel is armed with a beam rifle and two beam sabers, and it carries a shield similar to that of the Strike, with an anti-beam coating that protects the mobile suit from energy weapons. After its capture, this machine is assigned to ZAFT pilot Yzak Joule.

character.name: GAT-X207 Blitz Gundam
character.description: The Blitz Gundam is one of four prototype Earth Alliance mobile suits captured by ZAFT. Its X200-series frame is designed to support special weapons, in particular the Mirage Colloid system which renders the mobile suit totally invisible to radar, infra-red sensors, and even the naked eye. Using its stealth capabilities to infiltrate enemy territory, the Blitz can then carry out surprise attacks with its rocket-propelled grappling claw and the various weapons built into its Trikeros shield system. After its capture, this machine is assigned to ZAFT pilot Nicol Amalfi.

character.name: GAT-X303 Aegis Gundam
character.description: The Aegis Gundam is one of four prototype Earth Alliance mobile suits captured by ZAFT. Its X300-series frame allows it to transform into a clawed mobile armour form, which can seize enemy ships and mobile suits and then destroy them with its built-in beam weapons. The Aegis is equally formidable in its mobile suit form, which carries a beam rifle and a shield with anti-beam coating. As its name suggests, the Aegis was meant to serve as a command unit, watching over the other GAT-X units in battle. After its capture, this machine is assigned to ZAFT pilot Athrun Zala.

character.name: ZGMF-515 CGUE
character.description: A high-performance mobile suit developed in the early days of the war as a replacement for the GINN. The CGUE has higher mobility than its predecessor and is equipped with new and improved weapons, including a built-in vulcan cannon in the shield on its left arm. However, the CGUE never reached the mass production stage, and the few units that were produced have been assigned to commanders like Rau Le Creuset.

character.name: ZGMF-1017 GINN
character.description: The first combat mobile suit developed by ZAFT, and the backbone of its military forces. The fighting strength of the GINN is equivalent to that of five Earth Alliance mobile armours, and can singlehandedly destroy an Alliance escort ship. Although the GINN is classified as a Zero Gravity Maneuver Fighter, it can operate on Earth as well, and this versatile machine can be adapted to a wide range of mission roles and combat environments. Its standard armament consists of a machine gun and a blade for slicing apart enemy mobile armours, but the GINN can also be outfitted with a variety of heavy weapons and guided missiles.

character.name: AMF-101 DINN
character.description: A flying mobile suit developed for ZAFT`s invasion of Earth. The DINN is capable of independent flight in Earth`s atmosphere, allowing it to carry out aerial attacks or provide air support for ZAFT`s ground forces. These machines are also stationed aboard Vosgulov-class submarine carriers, providing ZAFT`s naval vessels with substantial air power as well. Similar in design to the high-performance command mobile suit CGUE, which was created by the same designers, the DINN is equipped with variable-geometry wings and a variety of anti-air and anti-ground weapons.

character.name: TFA-2 ZuOOT
character.description: An artillery mobile suit introduced in the earliest stages of ZAFT`s Earth invasion. The ZuOOT is based on the worker machines which were the ancestors of ZAFT`s military mobile suits. With its limited mobility and poor close combat capabilities, the ZuOOT is more like a movable gun turret than a true mobile suit, and this machine is used mostly to provide fire support from the rear. It can also transform into a tank mode equipped with caterpillar tracks, for greater stability while firing its cannons.

character.name: ZGMF-600 GuAIZ
character.description: A mass-produced mobile suit developed by Maius Military Industries as a successor to the GINN. Created using technology from the Earth Alliance`s captured Gundams, the GuAIZ is superior even to the high-performance CGUE. In addition to a beam rifle, it`s armed with two beam claws built into its shield, and a pair of extensional arrestors which can be used to grapple enemy mobile suits. Rau Le Creuset is one of the first ZAFT pilots to use the GuAIZ in combat. Aside from its colour scheme, his command version is identical to the regular model.

character.name: UMF-4A GOOhN
character.description: An underwater mobile suit developed for ZAFT`s invasion of Earth, and deployed along major shipping routes in the Atlantic and Pacific Oceans. Used primarily for attacking enemy vessels and coastal bases, the GOOhN is designed for high speed and firepower, but its manoeuvrability is relatively low and it performs poorly on land. Its armament includes two phonon maser cannons and a battery of rocket-propelled torpedo launchers which can be used both in and out of the water, as well as a pair of powerful supercavitating torpedoes for underwater attacks.

character.name: UMF-5 ZnO
character.description: ZAFT`s newest underwater mobile suit. Unlike the earlier GOOhN model, the ZnO was designed specifically for close combat, in the expectation that the Earth Alliance would soon develop its own underwater mobile weapons. The ZnO is equipped with powerful claws, rather than standard manipulator hands, and the phonon maser cannons installed in its palms can be used for devastating point-blank attacks.

character.name: Guul
character.description: This unmanned aircraft serves as a support platform for mobile suits that can`t fly in Earth`s atmosphere. Its high thrust allows the Guul to make vertical take-offs and landings, and perform aerial manoeuvres even while carrying a mobile suit on its back. The Guul is armed with missile launchers which can be remotely controlled by the mobile suit`s pilot, and its wing sections fold up for storage aboard ZAFT`s Vosgulov-class submarine carriers.

character.name: TMF/A-802 BuCUE
character.description: This four-legged mobile suit is the main weapon of ZAFT`s ground forces. Its quadrupedal design makes the BuCUE very stable even in difficult terrain like deserts and snowfields, and its legs are equipped with caterpillar tracks for high-speed movement in these environments. The turret hardpoint on its back can carry either powerful railguns or a large missile pod, and after the Earth Alliance`s prototype Gundams fall into ZAFT`s hands, many BuCUE units are fitted with head-mounted beam sabers based on the technology of these captured Gundams.

character.name: TMF/A-803 LaGOWE
character.description: A four-legged mobile suit developed as a successor to the BuCUE. This model is larger and more powerful than the BuCUE, with a two-seater cockpit for its pilot and gunner. The LaGOWE was designed from the start to carry beam weapons, but ZAFT has had difficulty perfecting this technology, and it wasn`t until the capture of the Earth Alliance`s prototype Gundams that the development of the LaGOWE was successfully completed. This mobile suit is now in the pre-production stage, and is presently assigned only to commanders like Andrew Waltfeld.

character.name: FFMH-Y101 Eternal
character.description: A new ZAFT warship, created to support the nuclear-powered Freedom and Justice Gundams, which is equipped with special facilities for maintaining these unique mobile suits. In addition to a pair of METEOR units, which function as gun turrets while docked with the ship, the Eternal is armed with a single cannon turret and countless batteries of missile launchers. After it is stolen by Lacus Clyne and her followers, this ship joins forces with the Archangel and the Kusanagi to form the independent Three Ships Alliance.

character.name: Nazca
character.description: The Nazca-class high-speed destroyer which serves as the flagship of the Le Creuset team. This is ZAFT`s newest model of warship, armed with powerful beam cannons and faster than even the Earth Alliance`s Archangel. Its central deck can house six mobile suits, and is equipped with a linear catapult for high-speed take-offs.

character.name: Gamow
character.description: The Laurasia-class frigate which serves as an escort for the Vesalius, and later becomes the mothership of the captured Duel, Buster, and Blitz Gundams. The Laurasia class, ZAFT`s standard model of space warship, is armed with a battery of powerful cannons and can carry up to six mobile suits. The mobile suit deck on the ship`s underside can detach and function as a reentry-capable landing capsule.

character.name: Lesseps
character.description: This land battleship, named after the 19th-century diplomat Ferdinand de Lesseps, serves as the flagship of Andrew Waltfeld`s forces. The Lesseps is designed to travel half-submerged in the sand, using the arrays of microscopic scale motors on its lower hull to liquefy the ground and propel the ship forward. In addition to its powerful cannons and missile launchers, the Lesseps is equipped with underground torpedoes which use their own scale motors to burrow through the ground. Its primary function, however, is as a mobile suit carrier, and vessels of this type are classified as land carriers by the Earth Alliance forces.

character.name: Petrie
character.description: This is another model of land battleship used by Andrew Waltfeld`s forces. Like the Lesseps, these vessels use scale motors to travel through the desert sands, but they`re smaller and less heavily armed than Waltfeld`s flagship. Waltfeld deploys two such ships, the Petrie and the Henry Carter (both named after prominent Egyptologists), against the Archangel and its Desert Dawn allies.

character.name: Cousteau
character.description: One of the Vosgulov-class submarine carriers which have given ZAFT control of Earth`s oceans. While these submarines are formidable in their own right, their most powerful weapons are the mobile suits and aircraft they carry. Each Vosgulov-class carrier is equipped with four dry tubes capable of storing two underwater mobile suits apiece, as well as four smaller tubes for launching fighter aircraft and three vertical catapults for regular mobile suits. However, the vessel must surface to deploy its fighters and use its vertical catapults. The Cousteau, which becomes the mothership of the elite Zala team, is named after the famous oceanographer Jacques Cousteau.

character.name: MBF-02 Strike Rouge
character.description: After the Strike Gundam is destroyed in battle, it is salvaged and rebuilt by the engineers of Morgenroete, who later use the spare parts created during this repair process to construct a duplicate of the original mobile suit. The Strike Rouge is equipped with a power extender to increase its operating time, and as a result its colours are red-shifted when its Phase Shift Armor is activated. It also has an AI (Artificial Intelligence) support system to assist inexperienced pilots. The parts for the Strike Rouge are carried into space aboard the warship Kusanagi, and when the mobile suit is assembled it becomes Cagalli Yula Athha`s personal machine.

character.name: MBF-M1 Astray
character.description: The final production version of the Astray series, designed for use by the Orb Union`s national defence forces. The M1 Astray was developed by Morgenroete, using technology that the company obtained from its work on the Earth Alliance`s GAT-X series. Based on the prototype Gundam Astray, this machine has been redesigned for mass production, and is equipped with a backpack flight unit inspired by the Strike Gundam`s Aile Striker pack. The M1 is more than a match for the mass-produced mobile suits of ZAFT and the Earth Alliance, but its production and deployment have been delayed until its operating system can be adapted for use by Natural pilots.

character.name: Orb Kaigun Aegis Kan
character.description: The Aegis ships which guard the territorial waters of the Orb Union use a trimaran construction, in which the ship`s hull is divided into three sections. Armed with batteries of anti-air and anti-ship weapons, as well as three aircraft decks which can be used to deploy combat helicopters, these ships are capable of driving off even ZAFT mobile suits.

character.name: Kusanagi
character.description: The second ship of the Izumo class, which was created to travel between the resource satellite Heliopolis, and the Orb homeland. Only the Kusanagi`s central module travels in and out of Earth`s atmosphere, and once in orbit it docks with the other modules to form a full-sized warship. Created by Morgenroete, this ship is similar in design to the Archangel, with lower firepower but a far greater mobile suit carrying capacity. When the Orb Union falls to the Earth Alliance, the Kusanagi carries Cagalli Yula Athha and her comrades into space, and it goes on to become the mothership of Orb`s remaining M1 Astray mobile suit forces.

character.name: Silverwind
character.description: A civilian space shuttle which is sent to inspect the remnants of Junius Seven, prior to the memorial service marking the one-year anniversary of the Bloody Valentine tragedy. The Silverwind is intercepted en route by Earth Alliance forces, who board the shuttle and trigger an argument that escalates until the shuttle is destroyed. At the last minute, a key member of the memorial delegation is evacuated in one of the Silverwind`s lifepods...

character.name: Asagi Caldwell
character.description: Asagi Caldwell is one of three young women who serve as the test pilots for MBF-M1 Astray in Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. Asagi, distinguished by her blonde hair, is effectively the leader of the trio. When these inexperienced test pilots are plunged into real combat, Asagi manages to turn them into a formidable fighting team. She is killed by an EA Strike Dagger.

character.name: Juri Wu Nien
character.description: Juri Wu Nien is another of the three MBF-M1 Astray test pilots in Mobile Suit Gundam SEED, whose strong teamwork makes up for their lack of combat experience. Juri can be identified by her trademark glasses, which she wears even in her pilot suit.

character.name: Mayura Labatt
character.description: Maruya Labbatt is one of the three young women who serve as test pilots for the MBF-M1 Astray in Mobile Suit Gundam SEED. Mayura is distinguished by her short hair and tomboyish demeanor. She was destroyed by an EA GAT-01 Strike Dagger.

character.name: Marco Morassim
character.description: The commander of a ZAFT submarine carrier force assigned to the Carpentaria Base. After Rau Le Creuset requests his aid in the pursuit of the Archangel, Morassim becomes determined to outdo the upstart Le Creuset by destroying the enemy ship himself. This veteran soldier often enters battle as a mobile suit pilot, and he`s equally adept at the controls of the aerial DINN and the underwater ZnO types.

character.name: GAT-X105+AQM/E-YM1 Perfect Strike Gundam
character.description: Only appeared in the HD Remaster.

episode.title: 偽りの平和
False Peace
Phase-01 - Une paix mensongère
Itsuwari no Heiwa
episode.summary: 11 months have passed since the Earth Alliance and ZAFT (Zodiac Alliance of Freedom Treaty) entered into war. In L5, on the resource satellite Heliopolis of the neutral nation Orb… On this colony, Industrial College student Kira Yamato, as usual, heads for the lab where he accidentally gets involved in a Gundam extortion plan by the invading ZAFT forces. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: その名はガンダム
Its Name is Gundam
Phase-02 - Son nom est « Gundam »
Sono Na wa Gundam
episode.summary: Within the flames, Athrun steals the last Gundam, MS Aegis, and escapes. Kira and Murrue also get onto Strike Gundam and barely escape as the factory explodes. But ZAFT’s MS GINN was waiting for them! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 崩壊の大地
Collapsing Land
Phase-03 - Terre de destruction
Houkai no Daichi
episode.summary: Rau, piloting MS CGUE, attacks Kira. Just then Archangel appears in front of them. Strike Gundam’s cannon fired at Rau opens a large hole into the colony. Everyone is stunned by its power. Seeing that the odds are against him, Rau breaks away from the battle. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: サイレントラン
Silent Run
Phase-04 - À pas de loup
Silent Run
episode.summary: From the airspace of the destroyed Heliopolis, Kira returns to the Archangel with a life boat. Fray is discovered on board the life boat. Archangel decides to head for the allied military satellite Artemis to seek help. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フェイズシフトダウン
Phase Shift Down
Phase-05 - Phase Shift désactivé
Phase Shift Down
episode.summary: The 4 stolen Gundams loom in front of the launched Strike Gundam. The ZAFT forces decided to throw all Gundams into the attack. Kira and Athrun face each other again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙[そら]の傷跡
The Scar of Space
Phase-07 - Une cicatrice dans l`espace
Sora no Kizuato
episode.summary: Using ZAFT’s attack, the Archangel was able to escape the fortress Artemis, however, lack of supplies has become an increasingly urgent problem. Mu comes up with a plan and directs the ship to the Debris Belt to forage supplies from wrecked ships. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えるガンダム
The Vanishing Gundam
Phase-06 - Le Gundam qui disparaît
Kieru Gundam
episode.summary: Barely fleeing its pursuing ZAFT forces, Archangel takes refuge in the military satellite “Artemis.” However, the crew is met with the muzzles of the supposedly allied soldiers. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 敵軍の歌姫
Songstress of the Enemy Forces
Phase-08 - La chanteuse de l`armée ennemie
Tekigun no Utahime
episode.summary: The passenger of the escape pod rescued in the Debris Belt was a girl and a small robot – Lacus Clyne and Haro. Lacus is the daughter of the current PLANT Supreme Council Chairman, Siegel Clyne. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 消えていく光
The Fading Light
Phase-09 - Lueurs vacillantes
Kiete Iku Hikari
episode.summary: Finally the long-awaited rescue comes. There is brief moment of calm in the Archangel. They are to join the advance escort ship Montgomery, Bernard and Law. Fray’s father, Vice Foreign Minister of the Atlantic Federation George Allster, is aboard on Montgomery. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 分かたれた道
Separate Ways
Phase-10 - Chemins divergents
Wakatareta Michi
episode.summary: The Archangel was able to stop the attack from ZAFT ship Vesalius by using Lacus Clyne as hostage, but the shock was most detrimental, witnessing an entire fleet destroyed before the crew’s eyes. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 目覚める刃
The Awakening Sword
Phase-11 - Quand se lève l`épée
Mezameru Yaiba
episode.summary: As promised, Kira returns to the Archangel. A hearing is held but the issue handing over Lacus to ZAFT without permission is disregarded through the good offices of Murrue. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: フレイの選択
Flay`s Decision
Phase-12 - Le choix de Flay
Flay no Sentaku
episode.summary: The Archangel finally rendezvous with the Earth Alliance’s 8th Fleet. Lost in busyness, as if to be reluctant to part from it, Kira does maintenance on Strike Gundam when Murrue comes and thanks him for all his hard work so far. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宇宙[そら]に降る星
Stars Falling in Space
Phase-13 - Pluie d`étoiles filantes
Sora ni Furu Hoshi
episode.summary: On the Earth’s orbit, a fierce battle has started between the Alliance’s 8th Fleet and the ZAFT forces. Although the Earth Alliance was superior in numbers, Rau Le Creuset’s troops, with GINNs and all 4 Gundams, destroy the Alliance’s craft one after another. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 果てし無き時の中で
Within Endless Time
Phase-14 - Dans le flot du temps
Hate Shinaki Toki no Naka de
episode.summary: About half the episode consists of new scenes expanding into the creation of Coordinators, the origin of the hate between Naturals and Coordinators, the issues that escalated into the Bloody Valentine attack and the subsequent deployment of Neutron Jammers (or N-Jammers) and war, as well as some technical babble regarding the five mobile suits developed by the Earth Alliance. The rest of the episode consists mostly of old scenes (recap). The old scenes and new scenes are intertwined throughout the episode.

episode.title: それぞれの孤独
Respective Solitudes
Phase-15 - À chacun sa solitude
Sorezore no Kodoku
episode.summary: Upon atmospheric re-entry, to save Strike Gundam after the battle with Duel Gundam, the Archangel was diverted off course and have ended up in Africa, which is ZAFT territory. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃える砂塵
Burning Sandstorm
Phase-16 - Le désert de feu
Moeru Sajin
episode.summary: The Archangel landed on the desert in North Africa. Without any time to relax, they are attacked by the ZAFT forces at night. They are the elite ground squad led by Andrew Waltfeld, also known as the “Desert Tiger.” Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: カガリ再び
Cagalli Returns
Phase-17 - Retrouvailles avec Cagalli
Cagalli Futatabi
episode.summary: With the help from the “Desert Dawn” guerillas, Strike Gundam was able to repulse the attacking force of the BuCUEs led by Waltfeld. After daybreak, other members of Desert Dawn guerillas join the Archangel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ペイバック
Payback
Phase-18 - Œil pour œil, dent pour dent
Payback
episode.summary: Waltfeld, the “Desert Tiger,” attacks Tassil, the town where the rebels reside. Missiles fired from the BuCUEs engulf the town in flames. However, Waltfeld’s men gave the citizens a warning before the attack, so there were no casualties. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 宿敵の牙
Fangs of the Enemy
Phase-19 - Dans les griffes de l`ennemi
Shukuteki no Kiba
episode.summary: Kira and Cagalli go to the city of Banadiya, where the ZAFT base is located, to buy food and supplies for the camp. The two accidently meet the “Desert Tiger” Andrew Waltfeld when they are eating lunch and are baffled over his overly friendly manner. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: おだやかな日に
On a Calm Day
Phase-20 - Une journée tranquille
Odayaka na Hi ni
episode.summary: In a PLANT, Athrun has a day off after a long time and drives to Lacus’ mansion for a visit. Clyne’s estate is located at an exclusive residential area in PLANT, and the two happily enjoy chatting. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 砂塵の果て
The End of the Sandstorm
Phase-21 - Au-delà du désert
Sajin no Hate
episode.summary: Yzak and Dearka, who were in the Gibraltar Base, join forces with the Lesseps. Towards the battle against the Archangel, “Desert Tiger” Waltfeld accepts the reinforcement thinking more force the better. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 紅に染まる海
The Sea Dyed Red
Phase-22 - Quand la mer se teint de pourpre
Kurenai ni Somaru Umi
episode.summary: Strike Gundam and the Archangel, defeating Waltfeld after a fierce fight, take course towards Alaska. Cagalli of the “Desert Dawn” insists that she is needed on the ship and invites herself to come aboard the Archangel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 運命の出会い
Fateful Encounter
Phase-23 - La rencontre du destin
Unmei no Deai
episode.summary: Athrun, Nicole, and Rau join. The Le Creuset Team is finally gathered all together after a long time. Since Rau cannot go out to fight because of the preparations for Operation Spit Break, he appoints Athrun as leader of the Archangel pursuit team. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 二人だけの戦争
War for Two
Phase-24 - Une petite guerre
Futari dake no Sensou
episode.summary: Cagalli’s damaged Sky Grasper shoots down the transport plane that was carrying Aegis Gundam and crash-land on a small deserted island. She encounters Athrun, who was on the transport plane, on the beach. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 平和の国
Land of Peace
Phase-25 - Vers le pays de la paix
Heiwa no Kuni e
episode.summary: In Orb waters, the Archangel and the 4 Gundams of Zala Team engage in a fierce battle. Near the Orb’s territorial boundaries, the Archangel is gradually cornered by the Zala Team with its superb combination attacks. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 果てなき輪舞[ロンド]
Endless Rondo
Phase-27 - La ronde infinie
Hate Naki Rondo
episode.summary: Inside the Orb’s dock, technicians work on repairs to the Archangel damaged by the battle. Morgenroete Incorporated’s engineer Erica Simmons, who is also responsible for the development of M1 Astray, analyzes the data submitted by the Archangel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: キラ
Kira
Phase-28 - Kira
Kira
episode.summary: Through the good offices of Murrue, the student crew are able to meet with their parents within the Orb headquarters. Parents and children are reunited after a long time and they check each other’s safety, rejoicing in their happiness. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: さだめの楔
The Turning Point
Phase-29 - Un caprice du destin
Sadame no Kusabi
episode.summary: The Archangel’s repair and replenishment are completed and it prepares to leave Orb. Meanwhile, Athrun’s Zala Team is outside the Orb territorial waters, waiting for the Archangel to sail out. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 閃光の刻[とき]
Flashing Blades
Phase-30 - Le temps de la lumière
Senkou no Toki
episode.summary: Kira strikes down Zala Team’s Blitz Gundam. Murdoch and the other engineering crew congratulate him. He clenches his fist while listening to their praise. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 慟哭の空
Grieving Skies
Phase-31 - Le ciel des lamentations
Doukoku no Sora
episode.summary: Contact is lost with Strike Gundam and 2nd unit Sky Grasper, and the Archangel is in chaos. Moreover, the ZAFT’s pursuit is closing in on the severely damaged Archangel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 約束の地に
In the Promised Land
Phase-32 - Vers la terre promise
Yakusoku no Chi ni
episode.summary: Many were lost but the Archangel finally arrives at the Earth Alliance headquarters in Alaska (JOSH-A). But the crew is not allowed to disembark and is ordered to remain on standby. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 闇の胎動
Gathering Darkness
Phase-33 - Les prémices des ténèbres
Yami no Taidou
episode.summary: The assault by Miriaria and Flay towards the prisoner Dearka became a big problem in the Archangel. Natarle talks to Murrue about the importance of following military regulations and questions Murrue’s lack of control in handling prisoners and guns. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: まなざしの先
Seen and Unseen
Phase-34 - Au-delà du regard
Manazashi no Saki
episode.summary: The crew, who has supported the Archangel all this time, is upset to hear that the three are due to transfer. As if to make matters worse, orders are given that the Archangel will no longer belong to the 8th Fleet but now serve as part of Alaska’s defense forces. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 舞い降りる剣[つるぎ]
The Descending Sword
Phase-35 - Quand tombe le couperet
Maioriru Tsurugi
episode.summary: In Alaska, the Archangel is in a fierce battle with the ZAFT forces. The MS troops loom and surge forward. The main force of the Alliance were sent to the Panama defense so obviously they are facing a challenge. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 正義の名のもとに
In the Name of Justice
Phase-36 - Dans le nom Justice
Seigi no Na no Motoni
episode.summary: The report of Operation Spit Break’s failure sends the ZAFT National Defense Committee in chaos. At the same time, Patrick Zala learns that the latest MS Freedom Gundam, which was secretly developed by ZAFT, was stolen. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 神のいかずち
Divine Thunder
Phase-37 - La foudre divine
Kami no Ikazuchi
episode.summary: Heavily impaired, the Archangel barely escapes the self-destructed Alaska base. It heads for Orb in order to repair the damage and arrives at Onogoro Island. Cagalli, confirming that Kira is indeed alive, jumps on him with tears in her eyes. She tells him about how she found Athrun. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決意の砲火
Decisive Fire
Phase-38 - Les feux de la décision
Ketsui no Houka
episode.summary: With the fall of the Alliance’s Panama Base, the Earth Alliance loses the mass driver and the path out to space. Scheming begins how to claim the remaining mass driver on Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: アスラン
Athrun
Phase-39 - Athrun
Athrun
episode.summary: Kira and Freedom Gundam engage with the Earth Alliance’s latest three Gundam units, Calamity, Forbidden, and Raider Gundam. Justice Gundam, piloted by Athrun, emerges before Kira. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 暁の宇宙[そら]へ
Into the Dawn Skies
Phase-40 - Vers le crépuscule cosmique
Akatsuki no Sora e
episode.summary: Orb requests peace talks time and time again, but Azrael of the Alliance turns a deaf ear. The Earth Alliance has already decided to control Orb by force. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゆれる世界
Trembling World
Phase-41 - Et le monde trembla
Yureru Sekai
episode.summary: Kusanagi and the Archangel launch into space. Kusanagi’s docking is completed and they take course to the abandoned colonies in the L4 cluster to refill their water and supplies. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ラクス出撃
Lacus Strikes
Phase-42 - Lacus attaque
Lacus Shutsugeki
episode.summary: Athrun leaves for PLANT to see his father, the PLANT Supreme Council Chairman Patrick Zala, and ask his true intention in fighting this war. Kira volunteers to escort Athrun’s shuttle with Freedom Gundam. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 立ちはだかるもの
What Stands in the Way
Phase-43 - Les révoltées
Tachihadakaru Mono
episode.summary: At the Alliance’s Ptolemaeus lunar base, Archangel-class 2nd battleship Dominion flies in orbit and performs a combat simulation. In the captain’s seat, sits Lieutenant Natarle Badgiruel. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 螺旋の邂逅
Spiral of Encounters
Phase-44 - La spirale des rencontres
Rasen no Kaikou
episode.summary: The Dominion attacks to destroy the Archangel. The Alliance’s three Gundams are overwhelmed by Kira and Athrun’s combination attacks that are perfectly in tune with each other. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開く扉
The Opening Door
Phase-45 - L`ouverture du portail
Hiraku Tobira
episode.summary: Kira and Mu chase after Rau inside an abandoned building. The building was the Mendel colony’s generic research laboratory. Rau, Mu, and Kira engage in a gunfight. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: たましいの場所
A Place for the Soul
Phase-46 - Là où se retirent les esprits
Tamashii no Basho
episode.summary: The battle resumes between the Archangel and the Dominion. Rau launches Vesalius and weave its way through the two battleships, saying to target the Eternal. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 悪夢は再び
The Nightmare Reborn
Phase-47 - Un nouveau cauchemar
Akumu wa Futatabi
episode.summary: With Flay’s disk, the Earth Alliance now acquired the technology of the N-Jammer Canceller. Cunningly manipulated by Azrael, the nuclear missiles are shipped up into space. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怒りの日
Day of Wrath
Phase-48 - Le jour de la colère
Ikari no Hi
episode.summary: The gamma-ray of GENESIS destroys the front line of the Alliance fleet in the blink of an eye. It was ZAFT’s trump card, hidden all along by Mirage Colloid. It could take aim and easily be fired at Earth. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終末の光
The Final Light
Phase-49 - La lumière de l`apocalypse
Shyuumatsu no Hikari
episode.summary: The second ray of GENESIS destroys the Earth Alliance lunar base. The next target might be Earth. The Alliance regroup the devastated fleet, and launch the Peacemaker divisions once again. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 終わらない明日へ
Towards an Endless Tomorrow
Phase Finale - Vers des lendemains sans fin
Owaranai Asu e
episode.summary: Even with all the casualties, the fighting continues. Flay’s shuttle, by abandoning the Dominion, wanders into the area where Freedom Gundam and Providence Gundam are violently fighting. Source: crunchyroll
